TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {6771=First City Monument Bank provides banking products and services in Nigeria. The company has a presence in the United Kingdom and the Republic of South Africa. The company operates through 150 branches across Nigeria and is headquartered in Lagos. It also has a presence in the United Kingdom through its FSA authorized investment banking subsidiary, FCMB UK, and a representative office in the Republic of South Africa. The company’s product and service offerings are focused on three main areas: Investment Banking, Retail Finance, and Transaction Services. It serves corporate and institutional clients, small to medium scale enterprises, and individuals. Segments Retail Banking – This segment incorporates private banking services, private customer current accounts, savings, deposits, investment savings products, custody, credit and debit cards, consumer loans, and mortgages. Corporate Banking – This segment incorporates direct debit facilities, current accounts, deposits, overdrafts, loan and other credit facilities, foreign currency, and derivative products. Treasury and Financial Institutions – The Treasury and Financial Institutions group provides banking facilities to financial institutions (banks and non-banks) and funding support to the various business areas. The company is also involved in currency trading incorporating financial instruments trading and structured financing. Public Sector – This segment engages in government financing, collections, and transaction banking. Investment Banking – This segment provides banking services to large corporate organizations. The group is also involved in capital raising activities for organizations both in money and capital markets, as well as providing financial advisory services to organizations in raising funds. Associated Companies FCMB (UK) Limited: This is an investment banking firm, established to service the international corporate finance and investment service requirements of its client base and provide stockbroking services to the U.K. investors. Its stockbroking division CSL UK is a research and securities distribution firms for Nigerian securities in London. The company’s services include corporate finance, securities research, sales and trading, and representative office for FCMB plc. FCMB Capital Markets Limited (100% Ownership): Licensed by the Nigerian Securities and Exchange Commission as an issuing house and financial advisor, FCMB Capital Markets Limited is the local investment banking advisory arm of the company, specializing in equity and debt capital raising, M&A advisory, and other forms of financial advice to corporates. Credit Direct Limited (100% ownership): Credit Direct Limited (CDL) is a microlending organization in Nigeria. CSL Stockbrokers Limited (100% ownership): CSLS is a leading stockbroking and investment management firm in Nigeria. The firm executes a significant share of international portfolio trades on the Nigerian Stock Exchange. CSL Registrars Limited (100% ownership): CSL Registrars Limited is an independent share registration company that manages the register for corporate and quoted multinationals in various sectors. Legacy Pension Fund Administrators (PFA) (25% ownership): It operates in the pension industry of Nigeria.
